Summary (from SkyRiver): Dissent erupts within the ranks of the Runaways, a diverse group of kids who have rebelled against their super-villain parents, when soldiers from the planet of Majesdane attack in an effort to capture Karolina Dean, who they claim has done a great wrong to their race.

43.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
43.title: Batman : Gates of Gotham
43.author: Scott Snyder & Kyle Higgins, story ; Kyle Higgins & Ryan Parrott, dialogue ; Trevor McCarthy, et al
43.appears_in: , art ; Guy Major, colors ; Jared K. Fletcher, letters.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
Collects: Batman: Gates of Gotham 1-5, Detective Comics Annual 12, Batman Annual 28.

Summary (from SkyRiver): As Batman, aided by Robin, Red Robin, and the Black Cat, tries to discover the identity and motives of a villain called the Architect in order to stop his destructive attacks against Gotham's oldest families and landmarks, the true story of Goham's origin is revealed.

44.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
44.title: Batman : Imposters
44.author: David Hine, writer ; Scott McDaniel, penciller ; Andy Owens, inker ; David Baron, Allen Passalaqua, Guy Major, colorists ; Todd Klein, letterer.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
Originally published in single magazine form in Detective Comics 867-870.

Summary (from amazon.com via SkyRiver): "A warped variation of the Joker drug has caused those who use it to suffer mental breakdowns and embrace anarchy and chaos. With riots cropping up throughout Gotham City, the citizens find themselves divided into two gangs: one led by a Batman imposter whose mission is to bring law and order back to the streets, the other led by a Joker imposter out to punish the innocent and set Gotham ablaze. And in the middle of it all is the real Dark Knight but can even Batman stop an entire city?"

45.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
45.title: Batman : Knight and Squire
45.author: Paul Cornell, writer ; Jimmy Broxton, artist ; Guy Major, colorist ; Steve Wands, letterer.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
Originally published in single magazine form as Knight and Squire #1-6.
Summary (from SkyRiver): Knight and Squire, Batman's allies in the United Kingdom, try to preserve the peace in London when a magical truce is broken and the land of Albion is threatened.

46.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-

Summary (from SkyRiver): Growing up a teenager in the west Texas heat can be tough, especially for Jaime Reyes

the stellar, armor-wielding superhero known as Blue Beetle! Jamie discovers the source of the scarab and what it was designed for. Will Jamie be able to handle the truth about the scarabs power, or will it destroy him along with the Earth?

59.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
59.title: Red Robin : 7 Days of Death
59.author: Fabian Nicieza, writer ; Marcus To, penciller ; Ray McCarthy, inker ; Guy Major, colorist ; Sal Cipriano, letterer
59.appears_in: On the Shoulders of Titans. Part 2
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
"Originally published in single magazine form in Red Robin 18-21, 23-26 and Teen Titans 92."

Summary: (from SkyRiver): In an effort to stop a series of attacks on notable business leaders, Red Robin discovers a bizarre hunting game and becomes the hunters' chief target, and asks the Teen Titans to help him catch the Calculator.

60.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
60.title: Red Robin : the Grail
60.author: Christopher Yost, writer ; Ramon Bachs, penciller ; Ramon Bachs, Art Thibert, Guy Major, inkers ; Guy Major, colorist ; Sal Cipriano, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Red Robin #1-5."
Summary (from publisher's website via SkyRiver): "A new Batman watches over Gotham City
but Tim Drake won't give up on the old one in this volume collecting Red Robin #1-5. In his new guise as Red Robin, Tim won't rest until Bruce Wayne is found!"

61.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
61.title: Red Robin : the Hit List!
61.author: Fabian Nicieza, writer ; Marcus To, penciller ; Ray McCarthy and Mark McKenna, inkers ; Guy Major, colors ; Sal Cipriano, letters.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Red Robin #13-17."
Summary: Tim Drake develops a list of Gotham's worst offenders and starts working to take them down, facing many obstacles as he does so, including antagonism from the new Robin, Damian Wayne.

62.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
62.title: Robin : Days of Fire and Madness
62.author: Bill Willingham, writer ; Scott McDaniel, penciller ; Andy Owens, inkers ; Guy Major, colorist ; Phil Balsam, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Robin, 140-145."

Summary (from publisher's website via SkyRiver): "It's all-out action in this trade collecting Robin #140-145! Robin enters a new world of danger when he's recruited by the mysterious Veteran to join his covert military group, and a greater threat emerges in Blüdhaven when Darla Aquista is resurrected as the mystical Warlock's Daughter. Finally, an OMAC attack unleashes a deadly gang war."

63.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
63.title: Robin : Search for a Hero
63.author: Fabian Nicieza, writer ; Freddie Williams II, Joe Bennett, pencillers ; Freddie Williams II, Jack Jadson, inkers ; Guy Major, Freddie Williams II, colorists ; Sal Cipriano, John J
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
Originally published in single magazine form in Robin #175-183.

Summary (from publisher's website via SkyRiver): "The Boy Wonder attempts to deal with the fallout from 'Batman: R.I.P.' in this new title collecting Robin #175-183, the final issues of the series. With Batman gone from Gotham City, Robin must stop the gang warfare that threatens to overrun the city. And what does the mysterious Red Robin have to do with the situation?"

64.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
64.title: Robin : The Big Leagues
64.author: Adam Beechen, Brandon Thomas, writers ; Freddie E
64.appears_in: Williams II, artist ; Guy Major, colorist ; John J. Hill, letterer.
notes: Originally published in single magazine form in Robin 163-167.

Summary (from SkyRiver): Robin goes solo to battle a group of villains who take an entire hospital ward hostage. The only problem is that the gang is led by his former friend Dodge. Can Tim save the day and turn his friend from the dark side?

65.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
65.title: Superman : In the Name of Gog
65.author: Chuck Austen, J
65.appears_in: D. Finn, writers ; Ivan Reis, et al., pencillers ; Marc Campos, et al., inkers ; Guy Major, colorist ; Comicraft, letterer.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
"Originally published in single magazine form in Action Comics #820-825."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Superman faces off against the Silver Banshee, Preus, Doomsday, and, worst of all, Gog, who returns for another attempt to fulfill his promise to kill Superman.

66.heading: Major, Guy, 1973-
66.title: Superman : the Wrath of Gog
66.author: Chuck Austen, writer ; Ivan Reis, penciller ; Marc Campos, inker ; Joe Prado & Jon Sibal, additional art ; Guy Major, colorist ; Comicraft, letterer.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
"Originally published in single magazine form in Action Comics #812-819."

Summary (from SkyRiver): There's no end to the evils that Superman must overcome: Darkseid's minions, Preus, Weapons Master, and Sodom and Gomorrah, to name a few. But now Gog is back to keep his promise to kill the Man of Steel.

86.author: Larry Hama, script ; Ron Wagner, penciler ; Kim DeMulder, inks
86.appears_in: 22 p. in G.I. Joe, a Real American Hero, no. 57 (Mar. 1987)
notes: Summary: Returning to his castle in Scotland, Destro finds an imposter, Major Bludd, in his place. In exchange for the Terror-Drome plans, Lady Jaye, Flint, Jingles and Sgt. Day help Destro regain his seat using a museum's WWII glider. k. Bedfellows. k. Castles. k. Scotland. k. Destro. k. Imposters. k. Major Bludd. k. Lady Jaye. k. Flint. k. Jingles. k. Sgt. Day. k. World War II gliders. k. Gliders. k. Museums. k. Plans. k. Terror-Drome. I. Hama, Larry. II. Wagner, Ron. III. DeMulder, Kim. Call no.: PN6728.5.M3G2no.57
